directions:
Line Varoma tray with a large piece of parchment. Set Varoma dish into position, insert Varoma tray and weigh short ribs onto parchment. Season with 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp pepper. Fold parchment loosely around ribs to form an open parcel and set Varoma aside.

Place onions, carrots, celery, garlic and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and without measuring cup cook 5 min/250°F/speed 1.

Add flour and tomato paste and without measuring cup cook 5 min/250°F/speed 1.

Add Chianti and without measuring cup cook 10 min/Varoma/speed 2.

In a small bowl, stir to combine cornstarch and 1 tbsp water. Add cornstarch mixture to mixing bowl.

Add beef stock, dark brown sugar, parsley, ½ tsp salt, thyme, oregano and rosemary and without measuring cup cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 2.

Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper to taste, insert measuring cup and increasing speed gradually purée 1 min/speed 3-8. Strain sauce over a bowl through a fine mesh sieve, discard solids.

Place strained sauce and butter into mixing bowl and cook 5 min/Varoma/speed 2. Transfer sauce to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place 50 oz water into mixing bowl, set Varoma with short ribs into position, secure Varoma lid and steam 90 min/Varoma/speed 2. Meanwhile preheat oven to 275°F. Line a baking sheet with foil.

Remove Varoma and carefully transfer steamed short ribs to prepared baking sheet. Bake 1½-2 hours (275°F) or until tender, basting with reserved sauce every 20 minutes.

Transfer Chianti Glazed Beef Short Ribs to a serving platter and serve with blistered tomatoes (see Tip).

Tips & tricks

To make blistered tomatoes: preheat grill to 450°F or medium/high. Rub 3-4 stalks cherry tomatoes on the vine with 2 tsp extra virgin olive oil and season with salt. Grill tomatoes until blistered. Alternatively, place prepared cherry tomatoes under the broiler for 3-5 minutes.

ingredients:
64 oz beef short ribs, bone in
1 ½ tsp salt, divided, plus extra to season, to taste
1 tsp ground black pepper, plus extra to season, to taste
4 oz yellow onions, cut into pieces
2 oz carrots, peeled, cut into pieces
2 oz celery, cut into pieces
1 garlic clove
½ oz extra virgin olive oil
1 tbsp all-purpose flour
1 tbsp tomato paste
10 oz Chianti wine
1 tbsp cornstarch
1 tbsp water
10 oz beef stock
1 tbsp dark brown sugar
1 tbsp dried parsley
¼ tsp dried thyme
½ tbsp dried oregano
¼ tsp dried rosemary
½ oz unsalted butter
50 oz water
cherry tomatoes on the vine, blistered (see Tip)
name: Biltmore Chianti Glazed Beef Short Ribs
